title: Hide Strategy Session nav item and route all Book Strategy Call CTAs to /strategy-session

requirements.summary: Remove the standalone "Strategy Session" link from top navigation (desktop and mobile) while keeping all other navigation intact.
acceptanceCriteria: Top navigation (desktop and mobile) no longer displays a link labeled "Strategy Session" that routes to "/strategy-session".
All other existing nav links continue to work as before.

file_operations.description: Remove the "Strategy Session" entry from the navLinks array so it no longer renders in desktop/mobile navigation while preserving existing hash/route navigation behavior for all remaining links.

requirements.summary: Update the shared "Book Strategy Call" click handler to navigate internally to "/strategy-session" using the app’s existing pushState + popstate routing and scroll to top behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Book Strategy Call" in the TopNav (desktop and mobile) navigates to "/strategy-session" and renders the StrategySessionPage without a full page reload.
Clicking other CTAs that use the shared booking handler (e.g., "Book Call" in ContactOptionsGrid and CTAs in homepage sections) also navigates to "/strategy-session" from any current route.
After navigation to "/strategy-session", the page is scrolled to the top (consistent with other route navigations in the app).

file_operations.description: Change bookStrategyCall() to perform in-app navigation to "/strategy-session" via window.history.pushState followed by dispatching a PopStateEvent("popstate"), then scroll to the top to match the app’s client-side routing pattern (no full page reload).
